title: (x) Bauhaus - Pump Triline {Eduardo}
content: I'm looking for this typeface that looks like bauhaus, but its made of various lines. ![font](http://web.archive.org/web/20110116222241im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/11883.jpg)
author: samiam

comments.content:
And that's just the tip of the iceburg:   
   
Font-a-licious [Rolloglide](http://web.archive.org/web/20110116222241/http:/www.fontalicious.com/super/fonts.html) and [Gemini](http://web.archive.org/web/20110116222241/http:/www.fontalicious.com/shopping/FONstore.cgi?user_action=detail&catalogno=fam-0003)   
   
Mecanorma [Dubbeldik](http://web.archive.org/web/20110116222241/http:/www.fontshop.com.au/fontdetailc.php3?ns=&sns=&co=&co2=&id=fp-2647)   
   
 [Turbo](http://web.archive.org/web/20110116222241/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/321.html) from Aaron here at the Typophile critique forum   
   
Gareth Hague's [Pop](http://web.archive.org/web/20110116222241/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.asp?i=1048&p=results.asp?Image=ALT0000118)   
   
Blue Vinyl [Macrame Super Triline](http://web.archive.org/web/20110116222241/http:/www.bvfonts.com/macrame_super.shtml)   
   
There are lots of other multilinears. But I limited myself to   
just those remotely resembling Bauhaus form.
Stephen, you're a maniac! =D But it's Eduardo who got first dibs.
